rename.from: MEGA storage: remote error: tls: handshake failure
rename.to: [BUG] MEGA storage: remote error: tls: handshake failure

body:
~ # docker inspect rclone-webdav | grep -i '"Image"' | head -1
        "Image": "sha256:6b72dd188250c6b722ef9ac24091473f3e37eb8477d7846d0daa0412eda308cb",
~ # docker logs -f rclone-webdav
2025/06/07 03:34:49 ERROR : vfs cache: failed to download: vfs reader: failed to write to cache file: Get "https://userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl": remote error: tls: handshake failure

This error is usually caused by old no/old CA roots in the container.

I was trying to debug this but the URL doesn't seem to exist

```
$ docker run --rm -it rclone/rclone copyurl -vv --stdout https://userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl
2025/06/11 16:06:25 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.69.3" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copyurl" "-vv" "--stdout" "https://userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl"]
2025/06/11 16:06:25 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: Get "https://userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl": dial tcp: lookup userstorage.mega.co.nz on 10.2.0.1:53: no such host
2025/06/11 16:06:25 ERROR : Attempt 2/3 failed with 1 errors and: Get "https://userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl": dial tcp: lookup userstorage.mega.co.nz on 10.2.0.1:53: no such host
2025/06/11 16:06:25 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 1 errors and: Get "https://userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl": dial tcp: lookup userstorage.mega.co.nz on 10.2.0.1:53: no such host
2025/06/11 16:06:25 INFO  :
Transferred:              0 B / 0 B, -, 0 B/s, ETA -
Errors:                 1 (retrying may help)
Elapsed time:         0.0s

2025/06/11 16:06:25 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2025/06/11 16:06:25 NOTICE: Failed to copyurl: Get "https://userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl": dial tcp: lookup userstorage.mega.co.nz on 10.2.0.1:53: no such host
```

There's a URL in the first post in the linked issue: `https://gfs262n351.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl/xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx`.

The behavior does match the expectation regarding forward-secrecy vs non-forward-secrecy ciphers:

```
> openssl s_client -connect gfs262n351.userstorage.mega.co.nz:443 -cipher 'ALL:!ECDHE:!DHE' -brief

Connecting to 94.24.36.61
CONNECTION ESTABLISHED
Protocol version: TLSv1.2
Ciphersuite: AES128-GCM-SHA256
Peer certificate: CN=*.userstorage.mega.co.nz
Verification: OK
```

```
> openssl s_client -connect gfs262n351.userstorage.mega.co.nz:443 -cipher 'ECDHE:DHE' -brief

Connecting to 2a0b:e44:1::61
001FD20002000000:error:0A000410:SSL routines:ssl3_read_bytes:ssl/tls alert handshake failure:ssl/record/rec_layer_s3.c:911:SSL alert number 40
```

> > This may be relevant: [meganz/webclient#103](https://github.com/meganz/webclient/issues/103)
> 
> Using weak ciphers might indeed cause the Go stdlib to reject the connection
> 
> [@pp90opk](https://github.com/pp90opk) [@LeCommonMan](https://github.com/LeCommonMan) do you have a mega URL to test?

```
~# docker run --rm -it rclone/rclone copyurl -vv --stdout https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl/[redacted]/
2025/06/13 08:02:33 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.69.3" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copyurl" "-vv" "--stdout" "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl/[redacted]/"]
2025/06/13 08:02:33 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: Get "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl/[redacted]/": remote error: tls: handshake failure
2025/06/13 08:02:33 ERROR : Attempt 2/3 failed with 1 errors and: Get "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl/[redacted]/": remote error: tls: handshake failure
2025/06/13 08:02:33 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 1 errors and: Get "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl/[redacted]/": remote error: tls: handshake failure
2025/06/13 08:02:33 INFO :
Transferred: 0 B / 0 B, -, 0 B/s, ETA -
Errors: 1 (retrying may help)
Elapsed time: 0.2s

2025/06/13 08:02:33 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2025/06/13 08:02:33 NOTICE: Failed to copyurl: Get "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl/[redacted]/": remote error: tls: handshake failure
```
but  it is enough to do just:
```
~ # docker run --rm -it rclone/rclone copyurl -vv --stdout https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl
2025/06/13 08:06:30 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.69.3" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copyurl" "-vv" "--stdout" "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl"]
2025/06/13 08:06:30 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: Get "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl": remote error: tls: handshake failure
2025/06/13 08:06:31 ERROR : Attempt 2/3 failed with 1 errors and: Get "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl": remote error: tls: handshake failure
2025/06/13 08:06:31 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 1 errors and: Get "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl": remote error: tls: handshake failure
2025/06/13 08:06:31 INFO :
Transferred: 0 B / 0 B, -, 0 B/s, ETA -
Errors: 1 (retrying may help)
Elapsed time: 0.2s

2025/06/13 08:06:31 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2025/06/13 08:06:31 NOTICE: Failed to copyurl: Get "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl": remote error: tls: handshake failure
~ #
```

It looks like these ciphers can be re-enabled by setting the environment variable `GODEBUG=tlsrsakex=1`

Failing

```
$ rclone copyurl --retries 1 -vv --stdout https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl
2025/06/13 14:56:17 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.70.0-beta.8782.0c8cd7775" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copyurl" "--retries" "1" "-vv" "--stdout" "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl"]
2025/06/13 14:56:17 ERROR : Attempt 1/1 failed with 1 errors and: Get "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl": remote error: tls: handshake failure
2025/06/13 14:56:17 INFO  :
Transferred:              0 B / 0 B, -, 0 B/s, ETA -
Errors:                 1 (retrying may help)
Elapsed time:         0.0s

2025/06/13 14:56:17 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2025/06/13 14:56:17 NOTICE: Failed to copyurl: Get "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl": remote error: tls: handshake failure
```

vs working (the TLS connection was made - we can see that by the 404 error reported)

```
$ GODEBUG=tlsrsakex=1 rclone --retries 1 copyurl -vv --stdout https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl
2025/06/13 14:56:38 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.70.0-beta.8782.0c8cd7775" starting with parameters ["rclone" "--retries" "1" "copyurl" "-vv" "--stdout" "https://gfs302n114.userstorage.mega.co.nz/dl"]
2025/06/13 14:56:38 ERROR : Attempt 1/1 failed with 1 errors and: CopyURL failed: 404 Not Found
2025/06/13 14:56:38 INFO  :
Transferred:              0 B / 0 B, -, 0 B/s, ETA -
Errors:                 1 (retrying may help)
Elapsed time:         0.0s

2025/06/13 14:56:38 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2025/06/13 14:56:38 NOTICE: Failed to copyurl: CopyURL failed: 404 Not Found
```

issue.title: mega: fix tls handshake failure - fixes #8565

issue.title: Feature implementation from commits b064cc2..17b25d7

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
# PR Summary

Unified Command Logging and Go 1.22 Compatibility Improvements

## Overview

This PR enhances the logging capabilities across multiple commands by implementing a standardized logging approach, fixes compatibility issues with Mega storage for Go 1.22, and improves code consistency and documentation.

## Change Types

| Type         | Description                            |
|--------------|----------------------------------------|
| Enhancement  | Unified logging framework implementation across commands |
| Enhancement  | Added Mega API compatibility with Go 1.22 |
| Refactor     | Standardized systemd logging implementation |
| Refactor     | Transform package type renaming and consistency improvements |
| Documentation | Updated command help text and markdown formatting |

---

## Affected Modules

| Module / File          | Change Description                       |
|------------------------|------------------------------------------|
| `copy/`, `copyto/`, `move/`, `moveto/` | Added standardized logging capabilities with proper context management |
| `operations/logger.go` | Added NewDefaultLoggerFn for centralized logging |
| `operations/operationsflags/` | New package for unified logger configuration |
| `mega/mega.go`        | Added TLS cipher suite customization for Go 1.22 compatibility |
| `sync/sync.go`        | Refactored to use standardized logging implementation |
| `log/systemd_unix.go` | Improved systemd logging with direct journal.Print |
| `transform/`          | Renamed types for consistency and improved help text generation |
| `local/local.go`      | Added Windows junction point handling |

---

## Notes for Reviewers

* The Mega storage compatibility fix adds support for an insecure cipher suite (TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256) which is necessary for their API but generally discouraged
* The logging changes provide consistent behavior across commands while improving resource management
* Several commands have been updated to use the new centralized logging approach

---

## Additional Context

* Fixes compatibility issue with Mega API in Go 1.22
* Provides a consistent logging framework for command operations
* Improves cross-platform consistency with Windows junction point handling

issue.title: rclone: ftp tls handshake fail - no shared cipher

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put into solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`



#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Can't connect to ftp with TLS since 1.69.2.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.70.2 --version
rclone v1.70.2

os/version: openwrt 24.10.2 (64 bit)
os/kernel: 6.6.93 (aarch64)
os/type: linux
os/arch: arm64 (ARMv8 compatible)
go/version: go1.23.10
go/linking: dynamic
go/tags: none


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Openwrt 24.10.x (arm64 based)
Windows 11 x86 64bit


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
linux server (centos 6) runing proftpd (1.3.3g)


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone -vv lsf starmoon: --config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.70.2 -vv lsf starmoon: --config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.70.2" starting with parameters ["rclone.1.70.2" "-vv" "lsf" "starmoon:" "--config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"]
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "starmoon:"
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : Using config file from "/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: Connecting to FTP server
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: dial("tcp","<starmoon_ftp>:21")
2025/07/20 18:52:28 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: > dial: conn=117.84.102.242:54996->121.235.237.101:21, err=
2025/07/20 18:52:28 CRITICAL: Failed to create file system for "starmoon:": NewFs: failed to make FTP connection to "starmoon.org.cn:21": remote error: tls: handshake failure

==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 21 02:16:17 linux.localdomain proftpd[9032] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session closed.
Jul 21 02:16:29 linux.localdomain proftpd[9202] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session opened.

==> /var/log/proftpd/tls.log <==
Jul 21 02:16:29 mod_tls/2.4.2[9202]: TLS/TLS-C requested, starting TLS handshake
Jul 21 02:16:29 mod_tls/2.4.2[9202]: unable to accept TLS connection: protocol error:
(1) error:1408A0C1:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_CLIENT_HELLO:no shared cipher
Jul 21 02:16:29 mod_tls/2.4.2[9202]: TLS/TLS-C negotiation failed on control channel

==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 21 02:16:29 linux.localdomain proftpd[9202] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session closed.

=====================================
The above was tested with rclone 1.70.2 openwrt build. But I tested version 1.69.2 to 1.70.3 and beta v1.71.0-beta.8907 on both openwrt and on my windows desktop with same results.
rclone 1.69.1 works fine with same configuration files. See logs below.

root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.69.1 --version
rclone v1.69.1

os/version: openwrt 24.10.2 (64 bit)
os/kernel: 6.6.93 (aarch64)
os/type: linux
os/arch: arm64 (ARMv8 compatible)
go/version: go1.21.13
go/linking: dynamic
go/tags: none

root@OpenWrt:~# rclone.1.69.1 -vv lsf starmoon: --config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.69.1" starting with parameters ["rclone.1.69.1" "-vv" "lsf" "starmoon:" "--config=/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"]
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "starmoon:"
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : Using config file from "/etc/rclone/rclone.conf"
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: Connecting to FTP server
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: dial("tcp","<starmoon_ftp>:21")
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>n:21: > dial: conn=*fshttp.timeoutConn, err=
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: dial("tcp","121.235.237.101:60138")
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>n:21: > dial: conn=*tls.Conn, err=
movie/
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : 3 go routines active
2025/07/20 18:57:03 DEBUG : ftp://<starmoon_ftp>:21: closing 1 unused connections
==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 21 02:57:03 linux.localdomain proftpd[17167] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): FTP session opened.

==> /var/log/proftpd/tls.log <==
Jul 21 02:57:03 mod_tls/2.4.2[17167]: TLS/TLS-C requested, starting TLS handshake
Jul 21 02:57:03 mod_tls/2.4.2[17167]: TLSv1/SSLv3 connection accepted, using cipher AES128-GCM-SHA256 (128 bits)

==> /var/log/proftpd/proftpd.log <==
Jul 20 18:57:03 linux.localdomain proftpd[17167] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): Preparing to chroot to directory '/home/share'
Jul 20 18:57:03 linux.localdomain proftpd[17167] 192.168.18.1 (::ffff:117.84.102.242[::ffff:117.84.102.242]): USER movierc: Login successful.


<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the  [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
